19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.55: "Figlio di puttana, I don't think we're alone anymore." He hisses to you gravely.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.54: "What was that?" Ludovico whispers. The only response he receives is another clatter of noise.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.53: You're both struck silent by a series of heady thuds, coming from downstairs.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.52: "Oh, that's simple!" He smiles as he reaches for the bottles on his desk. "All you need to say is-"
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.51: "Oh really?" He ask with a giggle "Well, here's how you-"
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.49: "You have quite the ear for languages. I think I can teach you one last phrase. What would you like to know?"
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.48: With fresh peals of laughter, you continue your merry making and drain your tiny glasses. This time, you refill each of your respective drinks.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.47: "If you want to says that someone's lucky, you can say Avere culo."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.46: (You have gained a little favor with Ludovico)
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.45: (You have gained some favor with Ludovico)
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.44: "Something you can use every day, huh?" He pauses to rub his chin in thought.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.43: "I would say grazie di cuore to thank someone and really mean it."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.41: "You picked up on that quickly. What else can I teach you?"
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.40: You laugh together, chat and eventually drain your drinks. He refills your glass as well as his own.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.39: You spend the next few minutes doing what everyone does when they learn something rude in an unfamiliar language, which is use this new phrase as much as humanly possible. You impugn the honor of the chirping birds outside, the glasses in your hand, and even the furniture.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.38: "Ti amo is how you say 'I love you'." He chuckles and looks into his glass. "It's only a few letters, but they're so hard to say."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.36: "If someone is being really embarassing, you can always tell them Faccia di culo!, which means 'Your face looks like your bottom!'."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.35: (You have gained some favor with Ludovico)
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.34: (You have gained a little favor with Ludovico)
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.33: "Really? That's what you want to learn?" Ludovico laughs in surprise. "Alright, let me think of something."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.32: He flushes bright red. "I was hoping you'd say that."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.31: "Something funny? Hm... what do I have for this?"
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.30: "Now, what would you like to learn?"
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.29: "Specifically, I thought it would be fun to teach you some Italiano."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.28: "In our brief time together, you've already taught me so much. I was hoping to teach you something in return."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.27:
Content to torment Ludovico just a little, you smile devilishly and take your first sip of the grappa. It's strong like brandy, but sweet like a sour plum dipped in honey.

The taste lingers for a long while on your tongue.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.26:
He rummages around again in the bottom drawer of his desk and produces a bottle of wine before pouring some into your tiny glass.

This should be easier to consume in moderation.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.25: He pours some tea into your glass from the pot sitting on his desk. The warmth of the glass feels nice against your hand.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.24: "Don't worry, I have some tea right here!"
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.22: "Would you prefer wine or tea, perhaps?"
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.21: Some minutes pass as you sip leisurely on your respective drinks, before Ludovico says "There something else I was hoping to do tonight. I hope you don't think it's too foolish."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.20: (You have gained some favor with Ludovico)
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.19: (You have gained a little favor with Ludovico)
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.18: He flushes a deep red. "No- I mean, it is quite strong, but that wasn't my intent. I just thought you'd like it."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.17: "Ah yes, well it is a bit of an acquired taste for those that didn't grow up around it."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.16:
Excitedly, you hold the glass up to your nose and smell the drink, which has a scent of aged perfume. You take your first sip, and the taste is strong like brandy, but sweet like a sour plum dipped in honey.

You have tell Ludovico is happy that you're so enthusiastic about it.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.15: He pours the clear liquid into two small glasses, and you can already smell its potency.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.14: "It's grappa from my family's vineyard." He says proudly, uncorking it with a pop. "Wine is more popular these days, but my parents still cling fast to their traditions."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.13: Suddenly he perks up. "Oh wait! I have something that I've been aving for just such an occassion." He opens a low drawer on the desk and rummages through it, eventually coming up with a bundle of cloth. He unwraps it to reveal a worn glass bottle without a label.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.12: Standing up, he gently takes you by the hand and leads you to another chair near his desk. You take a seat.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.10: "Oh! What a lovely surprise." He says, resting his head upon your arm as he slowly returns to calm. "It's great to see you." He says with a wide grin.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.9: Near silently, you sneak up behind Ludovico and drape your arms around his shoulders. He yelps in surprise, and if it weren't for your weight ontop of him, you're certain he would have jumped out of his chair.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.8: He jumps slightly in his chair before he turns around to face you with a contented smile. "Why hello there, Yvette. I would love some company."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.7: Ludovico perks up in his chair and looks over at you, standing in the door way. "Ah, I'm glad to see you could make it."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.6: He scribbles diligently on a letter, and doesn't appear to have noticed you.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.5:
Checking your location against the address you deduced from your notes earlier, you look up and see a building marked with the symbols and crests of the Church. Unlike the well lit buildings up and down the street, this one is dark, save for the window of a single room on the second floor.

You're almost certain that room is where Ludovico is.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.4: After a few moments, your eyes adjust to the darkness. The hallways are only lit by a scant few rays of lights emanating from the light of the streetlamps peaking through the shuttered windows. The whole building is as silent as a monastery. This, you suppose, feels appropriate.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.3: Your heart quickening with trepidation, you step inside.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.2: Your heart quickening with excitement, you step inside.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.1: Carefully, you try the handle of the door and find it unlocked.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.node.0: It's late at night, and you find yourself walking towards the rectory where Ludovico is staying. He's invited you for some simple hospitality, but you already get the feeling the night might involve a little more than that.
19776.Clandestine Meetings.link.196: "As thriilling as that was, I wonder if I've overstepped my bounds..."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.link.191: "We should probably wait until things are a little safer."
19776.Clandestine Meetings.link.187: "As thriilling as that was, I wonder if I've overstepped my bounds..."

19776.Clandestine Meetings.link.116: "Personally, I found the danger rather... thrilling."

19152.Clandestine Invitations.node.5:
Reaching the end, you put down the letter, and consider this unexpected opportunity. You pick up and flip through the meticulous notes in your journal, and quickly deduce his home address. In fact, you could visit him at any time.

(Ludovico's Quarters are now available to visit in the Paris map)
19152.Clandestine Invitations.node.4: 'You've been so generous with your time these last few weeks, that I would like to repay you with some proper hospitality. Mes salutations respectueuses, An Anonymous Lover'
19152.Clandestine Invitations.node.3: Chère Yvette, If I know you as well as I think I do, you've already figured out who wrote this. While I cannot risk too many specifics, it appears that I'll be alone in my chambers for the foreseeable future, as all my fellow occupants will be absent due to a commitment in the countryside.'
19152.Clandestine Invitations.node.2: However, this mystery is resolved the moment you open the letter, and recognize Ludovico's handwriting. It's certainly well practiced, but he still puts some of the accent marks in the wrong places.
19152.Clandestine Invitations.node.1: You pick up and examine the outside of the letter, but it bears neither a sigil, nor a name. It's simply sealed with a blob of unstamped wax.
19152.Clandestine Invitations.node.0: Waking up with a yawn, you notice that Camille seems to have left a letter on your night stand.
15842.Benedictions.node.40:
With a polite nod you take your leave before anyone becomes suspicious. 

Well, even more suspicious, really.
15842.Benedictions.node.39: It's all an absurd performance, for the sake of gossipping parisioners who will carry your imagined circumstances far and wide. Yet, you can't help but appreciate the thought he's put into this.
15842.Benedictions.node.38:
While none of the other parisioners dare speak a word about it, you hear a collective intake of breath. Wind tensely whistling between their teeth.

(You have gained a little peril)
15842.Benedictions.node.37:
You finally reach the front of the line, and see Ludovico there, looking every part the humble priest, his thumb annointed with holy water.

"Approach, Madame Decaux."
15842.Benedictions.node.36: "Deo gratias," The crowd replies reflexively, yourself included.
15842.Benedictions.node.35:
At one point, a procession brings forth a reliquary containing the forearm bone of a martyred saint. You look at the people around you, and they seem transfixed by it. It's amazing to think that such a thing could still carry so much meaning for so many people. 

Did that saint ever imagine that this would happen? That they would affect so many, long after their death?
15842.Benedictions.node.34: Ludovico presides over everything from his lectern, speaking latin as if it was his native tongue.
15842.Benedictions.node.33: Ludovico presides over everything from his lectern, speaking latin as if it was his native tongue.
15842.Benedictions.node.32: At some point, a procession brings forth a reliquary containing the forearm bone of a martyred saint. You look at the people around you, and they seem so moved. Moved by the parts of a corpse of a man that died hundreds of years before they were even born.
15842.Benedictions.node.31: Thankfully, Ludovico's directions turn out to be correct and you find the church without any difficulty. Parishioners are still filtering inside, with a few loitering outside to chat and catch up on the news of the day.
15842.Benedictions.node.30: You hurry home, feeling like the eyes of the entire neighborhood are upon you. While the actual walk home is safe, every shadow seems like it contains a new threat, ready to spring forth and be your undoing.
15842.Benedictions.node.29: You take your time, during your stroll home. The weather is lovely, and everything feels brighter than usual. If feels like the start of something special.
15842.Benedictions.node.28: Walking home, through the 14th arrondisement, you puzzle over the morning's events.
15842.Benedictions.node.27: Outside the church, standing in the day's sun, you realize that you are absolutely exhausted. You decide head home.
15842.Benedictions.node.26:
"However, you may reach out to me whenever you like." He says, handing you a piece of paper with his address on it.

(You may now go on rendezvous with Ludovico)
15842.Benedictions.node.25:
"In fact, you may reach out to me whenever you like." He hands you a piece of paper with his address on it.

(You may now go on rendezvous with Ludovico)
15842.Benedictions.node.24:
"I suppose we will." Ludovico manages to cough, trying to hide his flushing cheeks from the crowd.

(You have gained a little favor with Ludovico)
15842.Benedictions.node.23: "I cannot force you to do anything you don't want to do, Madame Decaux."
15842.Benedictions.node.22:
"I'm prepared to go to any lengths you desire." He says, suddenly forgetful of the crowd around the two of you.

(You have gained some favor with Ludovico)
15842.Benedictions.node.21: "If you'd like, we could meet at a later time, for spiritual council."
15842.Benedictions.node.20: "I'm glad to see you here, Madame Decaux," he says just loud enough for the lingering parisionsers to hear. "I've head that your circumstances have left you with quite the troubled soul."
15842.Benedictions.node.19:
Ludovico says nothing, but you glance up at him and can tell your words have touched him.

(You have gained a little favor with Ludovico)
15842.Benedictions.node.18:
Ludovico says nothing, but you can tell the gesture has had quite the effect on him.

(You have gained some favor with Ludovico)
15842.Benedictions.node.17:
Slowly, you lower yourself to one knee, and the young priest reaches out his hand. Right as Ludovico is about to annoint your forehead with the sign of the cross, you look up and kiss his thumb.

The holy water drips down your lips and across your chin.
15842.Benedictions.node.16: You lower yourself to one knee, and he draws the sign of the cross on your forehead. The cool water drips down your brow and the bridge of your nose.
15842.Benedictions.node.15: You lower yourself to one knee, and he draws the sign of the cross on your forehead. The cool water drips down your brow and the bridge of your nose.
15842.Benedictions.node.14: "You may kneel," He says, gesturing with his free hand to the floor in front of him.
15842.Benedictions.node.13: Still, as the service progresses, you find yourself participating effortlessly. You know when to stand up, when to sit down, when to sing, and when to shut up.
15842.Benedictions.node.12: You sit down just as mass is about to begin. While you were raised Catholic, you found yourself to be far less zealous than most. This is the first time you've ever attended a church out for anything other than simple religious obligation.
15842.Benedictions.node.11: Someone behind you shushes your musings, but you ignore them. If they didn't like the truth then shouldn't have sat near you.
15842.Benedictions.node.10: Someone behind you shushes your musings, but you ignore them. There's nothing wrong with enjoying yourself.
15842.Benedictions.node.9: While most get up to leave, getting ready to go about their work day, you stand as the last in line, behind some of the other parisioners to be blessed.
15842.Benedictions.node.8: "Benedicamus Domino" Ludovico intones to the crowd, signalling the end of the service.
15842.Benedictions.node.7: It's a good sermon, though he tends to stammer when he makes eye contact with you.
15842.Benedictions.node.6: Slinking by the parisioners still exchanging pleasantries outside, you enter the church and make your way to an unoccupied chair, far from everyone else.
15842.Benedictions.node.5: It's a beauitful building, meaning that it was built when this neighborhood was still prosperous.
15842.Benedictions.node.4: Still, as the service progresses, you find yourself participating as if you'd never stopped. You know when to stand up, when to sit down, when to sing, and when to be silent.
15842.Benedictions.node.3: You sit down just as mass is about to begin. While you were raised Catholic, you found yourself to be a touch less zealous than most. In fact, you realize that this is the first time you've even attended a church since arriving in Paris.
15842.Benedictions.node.2: Stopping to greet the parisioners still exchanging pleasantries outside, you enter the church and make your way to an unoccupied chair, near the front.
15842.Benedictions.node.1:
"In fact, you may reach out to me whenever you like." He manages to cough while he hands you a piece of paper with his address on it.

(You may now go on rendezvous with Ludovico)
15842.Benedictions.node.0: Getting up a little earlier than usual, you walk south to the 14th arrondisement, so you can attend Ludovico's sermon. Much as he said, the neighborhood is poorer than most, and many of the houses are in even worse condition than your own. Which is saying something.
15842.Benedictions.link.23: "I'm about to start seeing a Catholic priest. I don't know if this is a good idea."
15842.Benedictions.link.22: "Charm, intrigue, and a hint of taboo. If nothing else, it's exciting."
15842.Benedictions.link.17: "My circumstances are most vexing, Father Sidotti. I think this will take more than one meeting."
15842.Benedictions.link.15: "I might need more than simple counsel, Father Sidotti. What are you prepared to do?"
15842.Benedictions.link.11: <Kiss his hand whien he blesses you> <Peril Icon>
15842.Benedictions.link.10: "My heart is in your hands, Father Sidotti."
15842.Benedictions.link.5: "He wasn't kidding when he said public speaking made him uncomfortable. What a mess."
15842.Benedictions.link.4: "Well, this is cutest sermon I've ever seen."
15842.Benedictions.link.3: "How many people sleep on the streets, in the shadow of this oppulence?"
15842.Benedictions.link.2: "Well, at least these people still have a beautiful place to pray."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.61: She holds the door open for you, and soon the two of you are whisked off to your destination.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.60: She takes your stunned silence as agreement. "Good. I'm glad we understand each other."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.59: "Oh, that is tempting..." She leans close to whisper in your ear. "...but I've already spent far too much effort to have the world miss out on how perfect I've made you look."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.58: "If you don't want my gifts and you don't want to go out, you should have just canceled."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.57: "However, I'm already here. So we are going out, and that's final."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.56: (You have lost some favor with Madame Gazel)
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.55: She stares at you in tense silence.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.54: (You have gained a little favor with Madame Gazel)
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.53: Her eyes drink in your every last detail. She wants your resistance, just so she can break it.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.51: Together, the two of you head outside, where René is awaiting you with Madame Gazel's carriage.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.50: (You have gained a little favor with Madame Gazel)
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.49: (You have gained some favor with Madame Gazel)
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.47: She laughs at the memory. "Of course, I had no idea why I was doing any of it back then, I just knew that I liked it."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.46: Camille heads down to the kitchen, leaving you and Honorade alone.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.45: "You're all set Madame!" Camille says with a curtsey. "Now, I must be going. The kitchen is an absolute mess."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.44: You get dressed, as per usual, with Camille helping you into your outfit. It's a little odd at first, having Madame Gazel there, but once the three of you all start talking, you realize that you really enjoy having the company.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.42: That warm whisper suddenly turns to ice. "So you will do exactly as I say, do you understand?"
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.41: "I thought so. After all, everyone needs to see how good I've made you look. Exactly how I like you."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.40: "Shall we go?" She asks innocently, as if it was all in your imagination.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.39: (You have gained a little favor with Madame Gazelle)
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.38: You look at yourself in the mirror, and you have to admit that Honorade has good taste. She spends some time adjusting your bodice, but before you know it, these adjustments slowly turn into something firmer, and more sensual. Yet, the moment you start to submit to her touch, she pulls away, leaving you wanting more.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.37: Without another word Madame Gazel firmly, but politely, ushers Camille out of the room.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.35: (You have lost a little favor with Madame Gazel)
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.34: (You have gained some favor with Madame Gazel)
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.33: "I liked being in control of all the details. I liked it even more when they fought back, but I still got my way."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.32: Honorade continues her ministrations, but you can feel her slowing down. As you sit there, frozen in place, you wonder how one tells the difference between unwavering obedience and boredom.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.31: Just as you start to pull away from her, she places her hands on your shoulders and forces you down into the at your vanity. Holding a makeup brush in one hand, she grasps you firmly by the chin with the other. "Protest all you want little Yvette. It won't do you any good. I always get my way, and you'll be no different."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.30: "I'm glad you're grateful." She replies with a contented sigh. "I've always enjoyed dressing others up like this, even when I was child."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.29: All that seems to matter is whether your appearance pleases her.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.28: This is different. Being pulled this way and that. Being fussily primped and preened without any consultation to you whatsoever. You're not the one in control here.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.27: However, those occasions were about comfort and efficiency. A ribbon tied here, a pin placed there. You were the one in control.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.26: This, of course, isn't the first time anyone has helped you get dressed before.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.25: "As I was saying, let's get you ready."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.24: "That will not be necessary." Madame Gazel interrupts.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.23: "Don't worry Madame!" Camille happily interjects. "That's something I-"
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.22: Honorade pulls a pocket watch from her bodice and notes the time, beofre putting it away. "It seems that I've already taken too much of your time. If we want to make it to our rendezvous tonight, you'll need some help getting ready."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.21: (You have gained a little favor with Madame Gazel)
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.18: (You have gained some favor with Madame Gazel)
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.17: You set the parcel aside on your bed, for later.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.16: (You have lost a little favor with Madame Gazel)
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.15: You open the package to reveal a gorgeous black silk dress. Expensive, and rather revealing, it certainly feels in line with the bourgeoisie.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.13: "It's true, it was a very sweet attempt." Madame Gazel admits, reasuring Camille with a light pat on the cheek. Satisfied, she sets her focus on you.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.12: "Madame you have to understand, I tried to stop her!" Camille wails softly.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.11: Some moments later, they enter together, with Camille trailing behind Madame Gazel. Your hapless maid is carrying a large parcel with a bow on it.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.10: Camille sets off to her new task with gusto, but you're not optimistic about her success, based on her stammered attempts at an argument in the stairway.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.9: She barely conceals a smile. "I'd considered it, but this was really more of an unexpected bounty than anything else."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.8: "I see. I had hoped for this to be a pleasant surprise."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.7: "I had a feeling that you liked being spoiled."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.6: "In fact, how would you feel about wearing it tonight?"
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.5: "I looked through my wardrobe and found that I had something which will look a lot better on you than it does on me."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.4: The parcel is placed in your hands, and she continues "This morning, I realized that we're almost the same size. I also know that you, ever the social butterfly, are always looking for novel outfits to wear at parties."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.2: A few moments later, Camille enters your room and whispers "Uh Madame... Madame Gazel is here to see you? Don't worry, I'll delay her until you're ready."
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.1: You hear knocking downstairs, at the front door. Camille answers it and you can hear an exachange, but the muttering is too soft for you to make out any specifics.
17134.Bearing Gifts.node.0: It's a few hours before your rendezvous with Madame Gazel, and you're in your room, just starting to get ready.
17134.Bearing Gifts.link.62: "Are you sure Madame Gazel? Perhaps we should just stay in..."
17134.Bearing Gifts.link.52: "Do you always try to dress up girls in your clothes before you romance them, or am I just special?"
17134.Bearing Gifts.link.41: "Do you always dress up girls in your clothes before you romance them, or am I just special?"
17134.Bearing Gifts.link.29: <Stay silent, stay still, and let her do as she pleases>
17134.Bearing Gifts.link.28: <Smile> "Oh Madame Gazel, I don't think I should be letting you do this."
17134.Bearing Gifts.link.7: "Are you sure that's the only reason you're in my room while I'm still half naked?"
17134.Bearing Gifts.link.6: "Ah, but I had something else in mind for tonight. I'd prefer to wait before trying that on."
17134.Bearing Gifts.link.5: "Well, I've never turned down a nice gift before, and I won't start now."
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.67: “France is changing, that cannot be stopped. It’s up to us to make sure that it changes for the better.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.66:
“I know that isn’t the whole answer, or what you want to hear. However, I need you to trust me Yvette, please.”

His voice is serious. Grave. Pained.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.65: “I promise that I’ll explain all of this when it’s over.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.64: “Still, thank you. It makes me glad to know I still have you on my side.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.63: Armand looks away, staring out across the lake. “It’s something… something that I cannot tell you about. Not yet.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.62: “Ideas about modernity, monarchy, and what makes France different from the rest of the world.” Armand says, almost automatically, before looking away from you and blushing for a moment. His breath mists in the air, as he stares out across the still waters of the lake.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.61: Isaac’s eyes widen and he seemingly notices you for the first time. “Oh… hello Madame. I was just giving your fiance some important files that he forgot at home. Please excuse my intrusion. Bonne nuit.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.60:
Breathing deeply, Armand recomposes himself, and gestures in your direction.

“Isaac, have you met my fiance Yvette Decaux? We were just enjoying our last night together before I left to prepare for the general assembly.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.59: “Isaac!” Armand barks sharply and suddenly. Even the crickets and the birds seem to go silent.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.58: “Armand, I know this is hard, but France itself is at stake here.” Isaac continues, oblivious to your presence. “We helped guarantee your election for our Bailliage, so you could do this for us. You said it yourself ‘We must-”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.57: “Isaac…” Armand presses at a louder volume, glancing towards you.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.56: “Armand, things are changing faster than we could have imagined,” the man called Isaac says, hurriedly pressing a small satchel into Armand’s hands. In the dim light you manage to notice the a few papers sticking out of the top of the bag. “We all knew tensions were going to keep rising after Bishop Bonteville killed himself, but this-”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.55: Isaac looks back and forth between the two of you and gives a slow, formal bow. “Please excuse my intrusion. Bonne nuit.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.54:
“The general assembly might be the last chance to keep this country on the proper course, which means we can take absolutely no chances.” Isaac glances significantly to the package now in Armand’s hands.

Your fiance is trying to look positive, but his expression falters slightly in the face of Isaac’s grave expression and warning.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.53: “We share a lot of ideas in common.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.52: “That… was Isaac,” Armand says evenly. “I’ve been corresponding with him and some of his associates about politics for a few months now.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.51:
Armand exhales and smiles, but there’s still an air of tension about him.

“Not right now, no. It’s all… very vague at the moment. There’s so much going on that I don’t want to give you something new to worry about.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.50: With that, Isaac leaves. You and Armand stare at each other, silently, for over a minute.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.49: Isaac looks back and forth between the two of you and gives a quick, formal bow. “You two are obviously in the middle of something important. Please excuse my intrusion. Bonne nuit.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.48: Isaac regards you warily as he continues. “Armand, I’ll keep this short. We all knew tensions were going to keep rising after the riots in Grenoble, but it’s happening faster than any of us would have ever imagined.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.47: Isaac winces as if he’d been cut. “I’m so sorry madame, that was very rude of me. It’s a pleasure to finally make your acquaintance.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.45:
He pulls you closer and stares out at the lake. “I know I’m doing the right thing for France by going, but I’m going to miss moments like this,” he sighs.

Armand breathes deep, preparing himself for his next words.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.44: “Isaac… what a surprise,” Armand starts, his voice flat and tense.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.43: Isaac places a small leather case in Armand’s hands. “I just wanted to make sure that he didn’t forget these documents. It’s quite fortunate that I found him in time.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.42:
Eyes widening for a moment, this man seems to notice you for the first time. 

“I... am Isaac, a good friend of Monsieur Armand,” he states, slowly and carefully. “I was afraid he’d already left for the general assembly.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.41: Your town is relatively small, and yet you still don’t recognize this man.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.40:
It’s then that a man stumbles out of the darkness towards you, glancing about himself, and trying to catch his breath. 

“Armand, I’ve been looking everywhere for you!” he whisper hoarsely.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.39:
You pull away from each other, and you stare into his eyes. His face is a mixture of excitement and surprise. He whispers to you “I hope every kiss we have is as good as that one.” 

Armand breathes deep, preparing himself for his next words.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.38: You’re not sure how long your kiss lasts, time seems to have lost some of its importance.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.37: “Yvette, I-” Armand starts, but stops. His talent for words seems to have failed him. Instead, he leans in towards you, his eyes closed.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.36: You sit on your newfound bench with Armand, your bodies close together for warmth. Side by side, you stare out at the lake. Its water is so still that it almost seems like a mirror, the luminous reflection of the full moon is only lightly obscured the by occasional passing motes of fog dancing across the lake’s surface.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.35:
He uses his sleeve to sweep the snow off the wide piece of stone, then gestures out towards the lake your town is built on the edge of.

“Our new bench may not be the most prestigious real estate, but the view is quite nice, and the company’s the best in the world.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.34:
You gently pull away and place a finger on his lips. He opens his eyes and blushes.

“Of course, we could keep enjoying the view, for a little while longer...”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.33: Your lips meet his and a joyful shiver runs through your body. His hand comes up to stroke the side of your face as his other arm hugs you close.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.32: Without a word, Armand leans in towards you, his eyes closed.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.31:
Your head leans on his shoulder. His body feels both warm and familiar.

The moon is full, the town distant, and it feels like you’re the only two people in the entire world.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.30: You walk along the edge of a lake, the only sound being the chirping of the crickets, the sounds of your footfalls, and the steady rhythm of each other’s breath.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.29:
Armand smiles, “Very well, Madame!”. 

There’s not much in the way of benches outside the tavern, but he finds a stone mounting block a short distance from the tavern.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.28: You step in close to him, wrapping your arm around his, before you both wander off into the moonlit night.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.27: He turns and holds out his elbow for you to grab onto, “Care for a walk?”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.26: “While I like Le Cygne as much as the next man, I’d prefer to end our night with something that’s just about us.” Armand says in a soft, low voice.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.25: Outside the night air is brisk, even the colors of the moonlit sky are cold. It’s a stark contrast from the fireside warmth of the tavern. Yet, despite the open air, it feels more intimate and personal than the small tavern you’ve left behind.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.24: He then fills his own, then raises his glass for a toast. “To the loss of our hero, destroyed by that which he loved the most.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.23: He waves to barmaid, who brings you a bottle of wine and some glasses, along with a loaf of freshly baked bread that’s still steaming when it touches the table. Armand fills your glass first.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.22: He then fills his own, then raises his glass for a toast. “To happy endings, may our lives turn out as well as they do in the stories.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.21: He waves to barmaid, who brings you a bottle of wine and some glasses, along with a loaf of freshly baked bread that’s still steaming when it touches the table. Armand fills your glass first.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.20: Armand sighs, “Oh, a tragic ending for our hero. If only he had never been late to see his captivating fiance, this never would have happened.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.19: “Ah, the kindling embers of true love would be reignited into a roaring flame. I would cast off my disguise, and you would completely forgive me for being late.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.18: “What say you, wicked woman of the woods? Would you be swayed by this huntsman’s charms?”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.17: “Obviously, I would be unable to resist your charms. Perhaps… you would feel same?”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.16: Armand leans in, his eyebrow raised conspiratorially, “Ah, but your evil ways would not go unnoticed for long. The whole town would live in fear of you, and as the heir to this Barony I would have no choice but stop you myself. I would disguise myself as a huntsman, lost in the forest and pretend to be blissfully unaware of your wicked predations. While I would be unable to resist your charms, I feel that… you might feel the same way about me.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.15: Armand is more animate now, his words coming out faster and faster “In that case, I shall have no choice but to disguise myself as a huntsman, lost in the forest, and happening upon your grand salon by chance. You might be intrigued by this curious outsider in your midst. This would lead us to talking amongst the birds, the deer, and your other refined guests about the natural order, and the beauties of the wilds.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.14: “How will you pass your time alone in the woods?”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.13: Suddenly he begins to perk up, and leans in close to whisper. “You’ll finally leave this place behind, living as a lonely hermit, far from the prying eyes of civilization. At night, children will whisper of the beautiful, wicked woman living in the forest, who reviles all of society.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.12:
He pauses, and takes a deep breath. “Enough of that! If I want to feel sorry for myself, I can do it on the carriage to Paris. Tonight is for making sweet memories.”

He waves to barmaid, who brings you a bottle of wine and some glasses, along with a loaf of freshly baked bread that’s still steaming when it touches the table.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.10: Armand gives an audible sigh of relief, while he usually cares about keeping his appointments, he rarely let’s something like this get to him. “I’m sorry, it’s just… the general assembly is so important, but so are you. I’m packing and writing letters night and day in order to get ready, but all the time I spend on that is time I’m not spending with you.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.9: With the wine finished, Armand pauses to place the bottle on its side, a curious habit he picked up from his father. He then takes a deep breath, and waits a moment before saying “The snow appears to have stopped. Would you… would you like to join me outside? I have something I want to show you.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.8: You spend an hour finishing the bottle together, pausing occasionally to nibble at the bread. All the while, you trade jokes, news from around the village, and simply try to forget that this is the last you’ll see of each other for months.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.7: The red wine is deep and full bodied, it smells of leather, blackberries and cloves. It’s some of the best you’ve had, and you can tell that Armand is enjoying it as well.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.6: He then fills his own, then raises his glass for a toast. “To France, to the general assembly, but most importantly, to us!”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.5: Armand fills your glass first. “My father’s been talking my ear off about this particular vintage. I hope it’s up to your standards.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.4: “Je suis désolé mon cher, it’s taken so much longer to get my affairs in order than I thought. Now I’m already spoiling our last night.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.3:
“Excellent! This is our last night together for a while, so I want to make sure that it’s a memory we’ll treasure.”

He waves to barmaid, who brings you a bottle of wine and some glasses, along with a loaf of freshly baked bread that’s still steaming when it touches the table.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.2: “Bonjour Yvette, I hope you weren’t waiting too long.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.1: After a few minutes of trying to read your book, but failing to really get into it, you hear a set of footsteps approaching your table.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.node.0: February 2nd, 1789 You take a seat at your usual spot in ‘Le Cygne’, a small tavern in your hometown. The hood of your cloak is still up, but it’s less to do with the snow outside and more to do with the fact that you don’t want to talk to anyone else here.
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.73: “Is there anything I can do to help?”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.72: “And what are you planning on doing with those ideas?”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.60: “What’s going on, and are you in trouble? How can I help?”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.55: “Just a girl from the village, please carry on…”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.33: “Actually, I’d prefer to sit somewhere here with you.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.25: “Nope, my animal guests would turn on you. Think ‘Diana and Actaeon’, only messier.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.24: “A mysterious, rugged huntsman, with a mind for beauty? How could I resist?”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.18: “Oh, luring travelers into my cottage, bewitching them, devouring their hearts, the usual…”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.16: “Oh, luring travelers into my cottage, bewitching them, devouring their hearts, the usual…”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.15: “I won’t really be alone, as I’ll hold elegant salons for all the finest creatures of the forest.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.10: “It’s true, the entire night is ruined. Our engagement is cancelled, and I shall now flee to live in the woods.”
15502.Back Then, Back Home.link.3: “It’s not polite to keep a lady waiting.”
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.51:
Your index finger idly brushes along the top of her hand, and for the first time you notice something there, firm and unyielding.

Her wedding ring.
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.50: After a few minutes, you decide to head home, still trying to make sense of what just happened.
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.49: She walks away briskly, leaving you alone in the tavern.
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.48:
Elisabeth stands up and gathers her things, hastily scribbling a note in her sketchbook. She tears out the paper and hands it to you. It's an address. 

"Write me a letter if you change your mind."

(Rendezvous with Elisabeth are now available)
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.47: After a few minutes, you decide to leave the tavern and head home, your mind still swimming with emotion.
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.46: With that, she walks away, stopping only to glance back one last time before she leaves you in the square.
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.45:
As the crowd in the tavern starts to move on elsewhere, Elisabeth stands up and gathers her things. She stops to scribble a note in her sketchbook, then tears out the paper and hands it to you. It's an address. 

"Can you write me a letter, when you want to see me again?"

(Rendezvous with Elisabeth are now available)
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.44:
However, none of these strangers notice. Without realizing it, they treat you and Elisabeth like any other pair of people in the world, and it's freeing. 

Like you've been holding your breath your entire life, and are finally able to exhale.
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.43:
She slowly draws her hand away from yours, making a point to tap her wedding ring against your own engagement ring.

"Is it really that bad? There are a million kinds of love, but we only have one life. Does it feel right to spend it with only one person?"
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.42: You stay and chat a little while longer, commenting on the strangers at the nearby tables, and trying to determine who would be more interesting to draw. Your mind often wanders back to what any of these people would say if they knew what the two of you were doing together, just paces from them.
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.41: She notices your change in expression. "He... doesn't know, and I don't think he needs to."
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.40:
Your index finger idly brushes along the top of her hand, and for the first time you notice something there, firm and unyielding.

Her wedding ring.
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.39:
Not knowing what else to do, you look around the square to find some kind of distraction. Your wandering eyes catch a flash of sunlight glinting off of metal, and that's when you look down and notice it for the first time.

Elisabeth's wedding ring.
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.38:
You squeeze her hand back, savoring your closeness together.

(You've gained a little favor with Elisabeth)
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.37: She squeezes your hand, slowly, tenderly.
15350.Awaiting Inspiration.node.36:
